quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nickname and Quarterback
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, purr, mascot. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which two football players played high school football together at Mount Carmel High School?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Donovan McNabb and Simeon Rice

questions.question: Who was the quarterback for the Baltimore Ravens when they won the super bowl in 2000?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trent Dilfer

questions.question: Sir Purr is the mascot of what NFL football team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Panthers

questions.question: Who is the former head coach of the Minnesota Vikings, succeeded by Brad Childress?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Tice

questions.question: Does the Big East have any teams with the same nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Georgetown Universitys mascot is a bulldog. What is its nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hoyas

questions.question: What is UNC Wilmingtons nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seahawks

questions.question: What was the nickname of San Diego State University during 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aztecs

questions.question: Which quarterback in the NFL is the second cousin of Atlanta Falcons quarterback Michael Vick?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aaron Brooks

questions.question: What was the name of the colourful celebration, conducted by the of the offensive players of the St. Louis Rams in the end zone, after scoring a touchdown?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bob and Weave

questions.question: What was the nickname of Oregon State University in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beavers

questions.question: Which one of these college-nickname pairs from 2006 is wrong?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of Denver - Rams

questions.question: At University High School in Waco, Texas, during his first game, football player LaDanian Tomlinson, nicknamed LT, scored how many touchdowns?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: What is the nickname of the University of Cincinnati?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bearcats

questions.question: Which football tight end said Im a f*****g soldier. in a an interview, after a game against the University of Tennessee?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kellen WInslow Jr

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Player and Career
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, expos, phillies. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Having played only one season in the majors with the 1959 Phillies, this player, popularly known as Sparky, later made his mark as a manager.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Anderson

questions.question: Which of these pitchers threw 7 no hitters during his career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nolan Ryan

questions.question: This player, known as the Iron Horse, spent seventeen seasons with the New York Yankees hitting 493 home runs. When he retired, he brought the crowd at Yankee Stadium to tears by saying he was the luckiest man on the face of the earth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Gehrig

questions.question: This Old Timer, known as Dizzy Dean, pitched twelve years for the St. Louis Cardinals, Chicago Cubs, and St. Louis Browns.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jay Hanna

questions.question: Old Aches and Pains played twenty years for the Chicago White Sox, winning batting titles in 1936 and 1943. What is his real name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luke Appling

questions.question: Drafted by the Montreal Expos in 1972, The Kid won three Gold Gloves as a catcher. He finished his career with 324 home runs and was elected to the Hall of Fame in 2003. What is his real name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gary Carter

questions.question: Which old timer struck out a total of 4 times in 1920 while playing with the Indians?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Sewell

questions.question: This player was caught stealing a total of 335 bases in his major league career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rickey Henderson

questions.question: This classy left-hander, known as Lefty, was a ten-time All-Star and winner of four Cy Young Awards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Carlton

questions.question: This player, nicknamed Mr. Cub, spent nineteen seasons in the Windy City with the Chicago Cubs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ernie Banks

questions.question: This player, known as The Lip, began his career with the Yankees in 1925 and finished it with the St. Louis Browns in 1945. He is a three time All-Star, elected to the Hall of Fame in 1994.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leo Durocher

questions.question: This player, nicknamed Baby Bull, made his debut on April 15, 1958 hitting a home run against the L.A. Dodgers. He hit 379 home runs over a seventeen-year career and was the national League MVP in 1967.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orlando Cepeda

questions.question: This batter was hit by a pitch 50 times in a season in 1971.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron Hunt

questions.question: This diminutive second baseman, known as Nellie Fox, led the Chicago White Sox into the World Series in 1959 against the Dodgers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jacob Nelson

questions.question: What player stole home a record 54 times while playing with the Tigers and As?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ty Cobb

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Team and Career
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, arsenals, carter. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1999s match for the FA Cup between Arsenal and Manchester United, who misses the penalty during the first period of extra-time, and who scores later on, thus deciding the outcome of the match?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bergkamp - Ryan Giggs

options.text: Not listed here as an option

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman Abramovich

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: FA Cup

questions.question: Which pitcher recorded 511 wins while pitching in the big leagues?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cy Young

questions.question: How many premiership titles did  Liverpool win during the period of 1992-2004?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 0

questions.question: During which season was the number of teams in the English Premiership reduced to 20?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1995-96

questions.question: This player was a feared homerun hitter during his major league playing career. He started his major league career in Milwaukee Braves and ended it in Milwaukee Brewers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hank Aaron

questions.question: During the 2004-2005 season, which team ended Arsenals streak of 49 matches without defeat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manchester United

questions.question: Which team won Treble in 1999?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manchester United

questions.question: Which of these players collected over 200 hits ten times during his career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pete Rose

questions.question: This Yankee slugger hit a total of 23 Grand Slams in his career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Gehrig

questions.question: Which team wins the English Premiership in the 1994-95 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blackburn

questions.question: With which team did Joe Carter start his career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cubs

questions.question: During which season did Arsenal become Englands Champion for the first time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1930-31

questions.question: Known as Charlie Hustle, this player played with Cincinnati, Montreal, and Philadelphia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pete Rose

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Joe and Second Baseman
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, phillies, yankees. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Joe was the youngest player to pitch during the 20th century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nuxhall

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: This Joe roamed the outfield during the Oakland As heyday of the early 1970s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rudi

questions.question: This second baseman had a batting average of .424 in 1924 while playing with the St. Louis Cardinals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rogers Hornsby

questions.question: This second baseman hit a game winning home run in the 1960 world series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Mazeroski

questions.question: This second baseman, elected to the Hall of Fame in 1989 by the Veterans Committee, played with Stan Musial, another Hall of Famer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Schoendienst

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pepitone

questions.question: This second baseman was in the middle of the Tinker to _______ to Chance double play combination.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Evers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Joe Torres brother Frank played with the Braves and the Phillies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Joe DiMaggio had two brothers who played in the baseball major leagues. One was Dom or Dominick. What was the name of his other brother?

questions.question: Which second baseman was known for breaking the color barrier?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jackie Robinson

questions.question: Joe Garagiola signed with the St. Louis Cardinals at the age of 16.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How many seasons did Joe Jackson play in the baseball major leagues?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 13

questions.question: Larry Bird graduated from Spring Valley High School.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

options.text: Boston Celtics and St Louis Hawks
Los Angeles Lakers and Boston Celtics
New York Knicks and St Louis Hawks

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Larry Bird was born on December 7, 1956.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This second baseman was part of the New York Yankees murderers row.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Lazzeri

questions.question: In the 1996-1997 season, which team broke the best record for an NBA season?

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Larry Bird and Shortstop
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, rookie, college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This player, known as Chocolate Thunder, was the first to jump right from high school to the NBA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Darryl Dawkins

questions.question: Larry Bird has a street named after him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This college basketball coach won seven straight National Championships between 1967 and 1973. Four times his teams went 30 - 0 and, during a stretch between 1971 and 1974, his team won 88 straight games. He was known as The Wizard of Westwood.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Wooden

questions.question: When keeping a baseball boxscore, which number signifies the shortstop?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6

questions.question: Joe Tinker was the shortstop in the famous combination Tinkers to Evers to Chance.“ What was the name of the famous poem that immortalized these three players?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baseballs Sad Lexicon

questions.question: This shortstop had a great year in 1962 winning his second consecutive Gold Glove, the NL MVP Award, and hitting a homerun both rightly and lefty in one game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maury Wills

questions.question: Larry Bird was voted thirteen times in the All-Star team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which player broke the record for the most home runs by a shortstop in one season in 2002?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alex Rodriguez

questions.question: Born in 1931 in Dallas, this player was a fan favorite as well as a Hall of Famer. He wore #14 and played his whole career for one team, a team whose inability to win had nothing to do with its star shortstops ability.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ernie Banks

questions.question: Larry Bird never played in the Olympic games.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Larry Bird was a first round draft choice of the Pacers in 1978.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This Venezuelan was a great fielding shortstop for the White Sox. On White Sox he teamed with Nellie Fox to form a great fielding duo. Who was this famous #11?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luis Aparicio

questions.question: Larry Bird played 13 years with the Boston Celtics.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Larry Bird was rookie of the year in 1980.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alex Rodriguiz
